content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jun 10 (APP):Following are the highlights of allocations under the Public Sector Development Programme (PSDP) for various ministries and divisions for the fiscal year 2025-26 announced by the federal government here Tuesday: a Total outlay of the PSDP for the fiscal year 2025-26 is Rs 4.223 trillion. a The share of the federal PSDP is Rs 1,000 billion while that of the provincial PSDP is Rs 2.869 trillion. a Board of Investment will get Rs 1,105 million. a Rs70,388 million has been earmarked for Cabinet Division. a Rs2.783 billion for Climate Change Division and Environmental Coordination Division. a Rs149.150 million for Communication Division (other than NHA). a Rs1.786 billion for Defence Production Division. a Rs495 million was allocated for Establishment Division. a Rs18.580 billion for Federal Education and Professional Training Division. a Rs39.488 billion for Higher Education Commission. a Rs15.005 billion for Housing and Works Division. a Rs23 million for Human Rights Division. a Rs1.904 billion for Industries and Production Division. a Rs6.026 billion for Information and Broadcasting Division. a Rs16.227 billion for Information Technology and Telecom Division. a Rs1.179 billion was earmarked for Inter-provincial Coordination Division. a Rs12.908A billion for Interior Division. a Rs1.912A billion for Law and Justice Division. a Rs3.465 billion for Maritime Affairs Division. a Rs4.253 billion for National Food Security and Research Division. a Rs14.343 billion for National Health Services Regulations and Coordination Division. a Rs1.676 billion for National Culture and Literary Heritage Division. a Rs761 million for Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission. a Rs2.500 billion for Parliamentary Affairs Division. a Rs2.095 billion for Planning, Development and Reform Division. a Rs22.415A billion for Railways Division a Rs650 million for Religious Affairs and Interfaith Harmony Division. a Rs4.792A billion for Science and Technological Research Division. a Rs503 million for the Special Investment Facilitation Council Division. a Rs133.424 billion for Water Resources Division.
